prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. Start by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Sketch: Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle with corners at (0.0, 0.0), (0.75, 0.0), (0.75, 0.6857), and (0.0, 0.6857). This sketch has 4 faces, the first one being created by the rectangle. Extrusion: Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.0391 units and opposite normal direction by 0.0 units. Scale the sketch by 0.75. This results in a rectangular prism with dimensions 2 units in length (0.75*2), 1 unit in width (0.75), and 0.5 units in height (0.0391). Part 2: Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.3643, 0.0, 0.0391. Sketch: Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle with corners at (0.0, 0.0), (0.0429, 0.0), (0.0429, 0.6857), and (0.0, 0.6857). This sketch has 4 faces, the first one being created by the rectangle. Extrusion: Extrude the sketch along the opposite normal direction by 0.0214 units. Scale the sketch by 0.6857. This results in a rectangular prism with dimensions 0.6857 units in length (0.6857*1), 0.6857 units in width (0.6857*1), and 0.0214 units in height (0.0214*2). Subtract this prism from the first one to complete the model. The final shape of the model is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height (0.0391+0.0214).</description>
